sections.heading: The Interest
content: Creating a specialized user interface for physiotherapists during my second semester of multimedia design studies captivated my interest.
The project involved blending professional medical aesthetics with a B2C dynamic.

sections.heading: The Thoughts
content: Embarking on the endeavour of setting up a headless-CMS with WordPress for the first time was exhilarating.
Leveraging innerHTML offered a nimble and efficient alternative to traditional DOM manipulation.

sections.heading: The Problematics
content: Setting up separate fetch functions for individual pages was inadequate, prompting us to find more comprehensive solutions.
The iterative process of revisiting categorizations highlighted the importance of adaptability.

sections.heading: The Solution
content: We implemented a switch function to dynamically fetch categories based on the URL.
This approach created a modular and efficient system for data retrieval tailored to each webpage.
